metadata.title: CVE-2023-52436 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: f2fs:explicitly null-terminate the xattr list When setting an xattr, explicitlynull-terminate the xattr list. This eliminates the fragile assumption thatthe unused xattr space is always zeroed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-lowlatency - 4.4.0-257.291~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1134-aws - 4.4.0-1134.140
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1179-azure - 4.15.0-1179.194~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-257.291~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1134.140').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1179.194~14.04.1').
